name: Packaging Boxes to Revitalize St. Joseph County
short_description: Rebuilding Together helps revitalize communities through assisting residents with their personal and professional lives. This event will include the packaging of supplies at their warehouse that will be used for the Skilled Trades Day and Community Volunteer Build Day.
description: Rebuilding Together helps revitalize communities through assisting residents with their personal and professional lives. This event will include the packaging of supplies at their warehouse that will be used for the Skilled Trades Day and Community Volunteer Build Day.
Learn more about Rebuilding Together at www.rtsjc.org.

Note: Rebuilding Together begins before all other projects on this day. Volunteers will be picked up on Notre Dame's campus at 7:45 AM and will receive breakfast at the Rebuilding Together control center.

name: Mural Paintings
short_description: The Robinson Community Learning Center will be repainting 12 murals on their exterior walls. The murals will be stenciled before the day of the event. The RCLC, located on North Eddy Street, is an off-campus educational initiative that was started in 2001 by the President’s Office at the University of Notre Dame in partnership with Northeast Neighborhood residents of South Bend.

name: Bowman Creek Clean-Up
short_description: A few blocks west of Riley High School and right next to the Crooked Ewe Brewery, students will help cleanup the mouth of Bowman Creek--stretching from St. Joseph to Carroll Street.
organization: City of South Bend: Public Works Department
description: A few blocks west of Riley High School and right next to the Crooked Ewe Brewery, students will help cleanup the mouth of Bowman Creek--stretching from St. Joseph to Carroll Street.

The University of Notre Dame, in collaboration with the City of South Bend, is currently carrying out a plan to restore Bowman Creek, a two-mile long tributary, from the significant pollution that has accumulated over the years.
To learn more about the restoration project visit www3.nd.edu/~bowman/.

name: Historic Leeper Park Garden
short_description: Leeper Park is undergoing a collaborative effort to build a garden with the community. Our volunteers will lay brick on two small patios that will serve as sitting areas by the gardens. There will also be work on irrigation systems and garden maintenance.
